basics.name: Neha Sharma
basics.label: Geospatial Data Scientist
basics.summary: GeoAI, Remote Sensing Enthusiast | Product Engineer II - Geospatial Data Science at Esri GeoAI R&D Center | Book Editor & Author - Smart Buildings & Cities with Remote Sensing and GIS

work.name: ESRI Inc.
work.position: Product Engineer II - Geospatial Data Science
work.summary: Working at the GeoAI R&D Center, responsible for building geospatial AI models, creating Python-based workflows, maintaining pretrained models, writing technical documentation and blogs, and ensuring QA of ESRI GeoAI tools.
highlights: GeoAI/ Spatial Data Science, Remote Sensing, Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Geospatial Python, Project Management, Product Engineering

work.name: Larsen & Toubro (L&T) - LTIMindtree, Mindtree and L&T-NxT
work.summary: Worked on geospatial applications and deep learning models. Developed custom deep learning models, user interfaces and open-source tools for satellite image analysis, drone video analytics, and spatial feature detection.
highlights: GeoAI/ Spatial Data Science, Remote Sensing, Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Geospatial Python, Flask, HTML, CSS, Leaflet, and Folium.

work.name: CEPT University
work.summary: Taught ‘Geographic Information Science - Foundation Studio’ for the Monsoon Semester in the Faculty of Technology.
highlights: Designed studio exercises and reviewed student GIS projects.

work.name: CEPT University - Center of Applied Geomatics
work.summary: Worked on the ISRO-SAC sponsored project for Urban Air Quality Analysis in Ahmedabad using geospatial and temporal data analysis techniques.
highlights: Performed spatial-temporal assessment of urban air quality.

volunteer.organization: Council of Architecture - Training and Research Center, Bhopal (CoA-TRC)
volunteer.summary: Organized and conducted national-level training program titled GAP (Bridging the GAP between Geomatics, Architects, and Planners), focusing on Remote Sensing and GIS in Architectural Pedagogy. Trained over 200 students and professionals.
highlights: Collaborated with IEEE GRSS Gujarat, PIADS Nagpur, NASA India, and NIT Bhopal.

volunteer.summary: Coordinated IEEE STEP events to facilitate the transition from student to young professional roles across India.
highlights: Guided young IEEE inductees under Gujarat Section and India Council.

volunteer.summary: Virtually educated an underprivileged child under L&T CSR initiative.
highlights: Enabled access to quality education through consistent mentoring.

volunteer.summary: Promoted the M.Tech Geomatics program, mentored students, and ran outreach campaigns.
highlights: Handled social media presence for Geomatics.

volunteer.summary: Volunteered for various events like national and international symposiums, conferences, and government-sponsored geospatial training programs.
Held various leadership roles during school years including House Captain, Vice-Captain, and student discipline roles.
highlights: Blue House Captain (2006-08), Yellow Vice-Captain (2009-10), Red House Captain (2005-06).

education.institution: Maulana Azad National Institute of Technology (MANIT)

education.area: Science, Mathematics, Social Studies, Sanskrit, English

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
